snippet: An appellate panel criticized Judge Sterling Johnson Jr. for having his staff members investigate a case concerning legal fees in disability suits outside the courtroom.
abstract: Federal appeals court reverses decision made by Judge Sterling Johnson Jr denying legal fees to lawyers of Mike Costello, paraplegic man from Brooklyn who had sued local businesses for failing to provide proper access for disabled customers; court takes the rare move of ordering that the case be assigned to a different judge, due to Johnson using his staff members to investigate the matter outside the courtroom.
lead_paragraph: An appellate panel criticized Judge Sterling Johnson Jr. for having his staff members investigate a case concerning legal fees in disability suits outside the courtroom.

headline.main: Federal Judge Went Too Far in Lawsuits, a Court Says
headline.print_headline: Federal Judge Went Too Far in Lawsuits, a Court Says
